title: Synthetic Recap
body:
HOUSTON (AP) — On a night where points were a precious commodity, Hakeem Olajuwon authored a masterpiece of old-school dominance. The Houston Rockets rode their legendary center to an 88-78 victory over the Dallas Mavericks, a win carved from the low block and sealed with a historic, 42-point eruption from "The Dream."

In an era of grind-it-out basketball, Olajuwon was an unstoppable force of nature. While teammates struggled to find their rhythm, the future Hall of Famer put on a clinic, showcasing his full arsenal of dizzying post moves, feathery touch, and relentless effort on the glass. Every Mavericks defender, whether single-covered or double-teamed, proved powerless to slow his methodical dissection of the Dallas defense. His 42 points were not just a number; they were the very foundation upon which the Rockets built their crucial road win.

The Mavericks, led by a valiant 19-point effort from Michael Finley, simply had no answer. They managed to keep the contest within reach for stretches, but any run was inevitably met with an Olajuwon turnaround jumper or a powerful move to the basket. He was the sole consistent offensive engine for Houston, and the Mavericks’ defense bent and eventually broke under his immense pressure.

Ultimately, this was not merely a game in the win column. It was a signature performance from one of the game's all-time greats, a reminder of Hakeem Olajuwon’s singular ability to take over a contest and carry his team, single-handedly, to victory. In a defensive battle, his 42 points were a monument to his greatness.
